content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the functions defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x squared minus 25, and denominator x squared minus 29, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>29</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x plus 5, and denominator 2 x plus 4, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> satisfies <math alttext="f of x, is less than or equal to, h of x, is less than or equal to, g of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="1 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, h of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The limit cannot be determined from the given information.

topic.text: 1.8: Determining Limits Using the Squeeze Theorem

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
